title: Ricky Gervais was 'flattered' to be asked to play an 'exaggerated version' of himself in Scooby-Doo
text:
Throughout his illustrious acting career, he's portrayed many characters including David Brent in The Office and Tony Johnson in After Life.

However, Ricky Gervais revealed he was 'flattered' after being asked to portray an 'exaggerated and twisted' version of himself in the new Scooby-Doo TV series.

The actor, 58, will star in an upcoming episode of Boomerang series Scooby-Doo and Guess Who? called Ollie Ollie In-Come Free!

Animated: Ricky Gervais revealed he was 'flattered' after being asked to portray an 'exaggerated and twisted' version of himself in the new Scooby-Doo TV series

In a behind-the-scenes clip ahead of its release, Ricky revealed how excited he is to be voicing an animated version of himself on the small screen.

He said: 'I love being able to play an exaggerated or twisted version of myself and I’ve always liked Scooby-Doo. It’s smart and there’s lots of different elements that make it clever.

'It’s very flattering to be approached to play yourself in an iconic cartoon.'

The episode in question will see the Mystery Inc. gang agree to help Ricky with an antique, and very haunted Egyptian statue of a cat (otherwise known as Bast).

New role: The actor, 58, will star in an upcoming episode of Boomerang series Scooby-Doo and Guess Who? called Ollie Ollie In-Come Free!

However, disaster soon strikes for Fred, Velma, Daphne, Shaggy and Scooby as they soon find themselves embroiled in a confrontation with the ancient goddess who returns in mummy form.

Discussing his illustrated alter ego, Ricky said: 'They’ve made me really mad, like a really weird old cat lady.'

But he was quick to add that he didn't hesitate to take part in the iconic cartoon, adding: 'I’m a huge fan of animation, so this was a no-brainer.'

Thrilled: In a behind-the-scenes clip ahead of its release, Ricky revealed how excited he is to be voicing an animated version of himself on the small screen

Fun job: 'I love being able to play an exaggerated or twisted version of myself and I’ve always liked Scooby-Doo. It’s smart and there’s lots of different elements that make it clever'

Ricky also went on to say that he's always been a fan of the crime-solving show, which first hit screens way back in 1969.

'I did like it as a kid but I liked it when I was too old as well' he explained. 'I don’t know what that says about me.'

'I even had to do a thing for charity recently, they asked me to do something that shows the memories of childhood that used to make me happy and I drew that...[shows a drawing of Scooby on his phone] so that’s how much I love Scooby-Doo!'

Watch Ricky Gervais star in all new episodes of Scooby-Doo and Guess Who? At 5pm on Monday 21st October, exclusively on Boomerang.
